intro: Eranthis, commonly known as the spring snowflake, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Ranunculaceae. It is characterized by its early blooming habit, often appearing in late winter or early spring. The plant features showy, white or pinkish flowers with five to eight petals, and its leaves are typically trifoliate or palmately divided. Eranthis species are often found in woodland or shady areas, thriving in moist, well-drained soil. They are popular in gardens for their ornamental value and ability to add early color to the landscape.
